medical_history.chief_complaint: Disseminated infection due to atypical mycobacterium Mycobacterium avium-intracellulare.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had a prolonged history of infection. Symptoms began approximately 4 months after treatment for possible Sch√∂nlein-Henoch purpura. After initial treatment with oral penicillin G and aerosolized salbutamol, new symptoms presented with regressive pneumonia, leading to a diagnosis of multiple abscesses.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has a family history of dominant IFN-gR1 deficiency and systemic infections due to atypical mycobacteria.
medical_history.family_history: Family history of systemic atypical mycobacteria infections noted, including 3 generations of affected individuals with dominant IFN-gR1 deficiency.
